WRITING.TEXT: For me it seems to much like unnecessary fan-service. There is always a very contrived reason to bring on Oliver in the crossover, and it doesn't seem like this episode has anything to do with the main stories of any of the shows.

I was wondering if I should just spring for it on ebay, buy the collection(brother has 1 and 2 but I may want to have my own copy), buy it from gamestop when they have buy 2 get 1 free, or wait for my pawn shop to get it?
Ya, I am from the US.

Three words....Gaara...vs....Toph
That battle made me the saltiest man alive.

WRITING.TEXT: I have every gears game besides 3 and I can't seem to find it anywhere for a reasonable price(missed one at my pawn shop so I am pretty salty). Do you guys know how much it normally goes for on sale, and how often? Thanks
Same, I was playing mass effect and then the next day I couldn't update my dishonored.
Thanks man I have had to do the exact same thing when my games update. I also checked my brothers xbox and his is having the same problem, so it must be server side.

Just wondering why the price would be so high if it didn't include the dlc.

WRITING.TITLE: Having slow down, freezing, load noises, and updating problems on 360. Should I buy a new one?
WRITING.TEXT:
My 360 has gotten loader over the past weekend, with some other problems. I don't know if the update problems are because of my Xbox or Xbox live(others on this sub were posting about the same issue),but it has been running slower(15 seconds to go to game details, when it would normally have taken less than 3) and freezing(when I click back during a loading screen on the dashboard it will freeze for 14 second). I have tried removing my hard drive to see if that was the problem, but it still freezes up when just using my 4gb internal. I was wondering if I should get a new Xbox 360?
TLDR: Xbox is running slow(not sure why) and I want to know if I should get a new one for $50-80. PS: I need a new controller as well and that would be included in the 360 I am looking to buy.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone know if this comes with the DLC when bought used?

WRITING.TEXT: I eventually solved by just trying again and again, probably something to do with xbox live.
I had the same problem, and microsoft support said it might be my hard drive.

WRITING.TITLE: Dishonored won't update. 360 also running slowly. Anyone else have this problem?
WRITING.TEXT: At first my 360 was loading really slowly on any page I tried to go to, and when I tried to back out it would freeze for a few seconds. After clearing the cache, deleting 50 gb worth of games, and re downloading my profile, Dishonored wouldn't update, but instead give me the error message "445E 0000 D080 0200 8007 2741". After unplugging my hard drive, re plugging it in, and clearing my cache 5 times, it doesn't show a download bar when it has to update. It just gives me the spinning circle loading screen.

WRITING.TITLE: What kind of stand would you guys recommend for the Ps3 slim?
WRITING.TEXT: Is the nyko brand any good, or should I try to find an official one?

It didn't run that great on 360, but it ran worse on One when backwards compatibility was first launched, but had better loading times, at least according to Digital Foundry. I am only asking because I know some games got patched to make it play like the 360 version, but have the faster loading times.
I know that they smoothed out some of the FPS drop problems on some of the Gears of War games and Halo reach, but I didn't know if they ever patched Mass Effect.
[Their video](https://youtu.be/_5VYl0pKbDU?t=445) shows it performing worse on the One.
I have both a 360 and an Xbox One, but I don't know which version is worse.
[Digital Foundry's video](https://youtu.be/_5VYl0pKbDU?t=445) shows lower fps, but better load times and no screen tearing. I am more concerned with fps.
I only asked because back in 2015 Digital Foundry said it ran worse.
I know, but according to Digital Foundry's tests it was under performing on Xbox One compared to 360. I just wanted to know if it plays as well as it did on 360.
